title: 1487-A
statement: A. Arenatime limit per test1 secondmemory limit per test256 megabytesinputstandard inputoutputstandard output$$$n$$$ heroes fight against each other in the Arena. Initially, the $$$i$$$-th hero has level $$$a_i$$$.Each minute, a fight between two different heroes occurs. These heroes can be chosen arbitrarily (it's even possible that it is the same two heroes that were fighting during the last minute).When two heroes of equal levels fight, nobody wins the fight. When two heroes of different levels fight, the one with the higher level wins, and his level increases by $$$1$$$.The winner of the tournament is the first hero that wins in at least $$$100^{500}$$$ fights(note that it's possible that the tournament lasts forever if no hero wins this number of fights, then there is no winner). Apossible winneris a hero such that there exists a sequence of fights that this hero becomes the winner of the tournament.Calculate the number ofpossible winnersamong $$$n$$$ heroes.InputThe first line contains one integer $$$t$$$ ($$$1 \\le t \\le 500$$$) — the number of test cases.Each test case consists of two lines. The first line contains one integer $$$n$$$ ($$$2 \\le n \\le 100$$$) — the number of heroes. The second line contains $$$n$$$ integers $$$a_1, a_2, \\dots, a_n$$$ ($$$1 \\le a_i \\le 100$$$), where $$$a_i$$$ is the initial level of the $$$i$$$-th hero.OutputFor each test case, print one integer — the number ofpossible winnersamong the given $$$n$$$ heroes.ExampleInput3 3 3 2 2 2 5 5 4 1 3 3 7Output1 0 3NoteIn the first test case of the example, the onlypossible winneris the first hero.In the second test case of the example, each fight between the heroes results in nobody winning it, so the tournament lasts forever and there is no winner.

processed.result:
You are given $n$ numbers, each representing the initial level of a hero.  Each minute, two heroes fight. If their levels are equal, no one wins. If their levels are different, the hero with the higher level wins and increases their level by 1.

The winner of the tournament is the first hero to win at least $10^{500}$ fights.  

Find the number of heroes who could potentially become the winner.

You are given a group of people with different starting scores. Every minute, two people fight. The person with the higher score wins and gains one point. The winner is the first person to reach at least 10^500 points.  Count how many people could potentially become the winner.
